hint.title: Paper Size
hint.text: Select a preset page size. Choose “Custom” to enter your own width/height below.

hint.title: Layout
hint.text: Controls the grid of cards per sheet. “Horizontal (2x4)” and “Vertical (3x3)” are fixed; “Auto” layouts fit as many cards as possible for the page and card size; “SevenCard” places 7 active slots on a 2x4 grid. Silhouette cutting is only available on fixed size grids.

hint.title: Units
hint.text: Changes how width/height are displayed and entered (in or mm).

hint.title: Page Width
hint.text: Width of the generated document.

hint.title: Page Height
hint.text: Height of the generated document.

hint.title: DPI (Resolution)
hint.text: Dots per inch used to size the document in pixels. Higher DPI increases quality and file size. We recommend 800 dpi.

hint.title: Card Format
hint.text: “MPC (with bleed)” expects full-bleed card images (typically 69×94 mm). “NoBleed” uses the default card size (about 63×88 mm).

hint.title: Card Width (mm)
hint.text: Single card width in millimeters. For MPC full bleed, 69 mm is typical. For NoBleed, ~63 mm is typical.

hint.title: Card Height (mm)
hint.text: Single card height in millimeters. For MPC full bleed, 94 mm is typical. For NoBleed, ~88 mm is typical.

hint.title: Silhouette Registration
hint.text: Adds Silhouette registration marks and generates a file layed out for use on Silhouette cutting machines.

hint.title: Experimental: Edge-to-Edge Registration
hint.text:
This is an experimental option that places the registration marks for Silhouette cutters near the edge of the paper. This option allows you to maximize the print area and allows for 9 card support on Letter-sized paper.


WARNING - READ FIRST

  • This requires that borderless edge-to-edge printing be supported and enabled on your printer.
  • This option only works for Letter size paper at this time for 9 and 8 card layout. If selected for other layouts it will not do anything.
  • This may require you to position your paper on your cutting mat with a slight offset of several mm from the left edge to be detected.
  • For the 9 Card layout, cards with a dark upper-left corner in the upper-left slot may cause difficulty with registration.
  • For cutting, make sure to use the correct Silhouette Templates.

hint.title: Print Cut Marks
hint.text: Draws corner cut marks around each card slot for manual trimming. Enable to configure size and offset below.

hint.title: Cut Mark Size (mm)
hint.text: Length of each cut line from the card corner. Increase for easier visibility when trimming.

hint.title: Cut Mark Offset (mm)
hint.text: Distance the cut mark begins from the card corner. Larger values push marks farther away from the card edges.

hint.title: Card Gap (mm)
hint.text: Space between adjacent cards on the sheet. Zero packs cards tightly; increasing creates separation.

hint.title: Crop Bleed (mm)
hint.text: Amount trimmed from each card edge to hide slight alignment errors. Typical range is 0.5–2.0 mm.

hint.title: Brightness
hint.text: Adjusts brightness for the entire sheet or batch. Positive brightens the image; negative darkens the image.

hint.title: Contrast
hint.text: Adjusts contrast for the entire sheet or batch. Positive increases contrast; negative reduces it.

hint.title: Vibrance
hint.text: Boosts muted colors more than already-saturated ones, useful for effecting skintones and softer shades.

hint.title: Saturation
hint.text: Uniformly increases or decreases color intensity across the image.

hint.title: Gamma
hint.text: Midtone correction. Values below 1.0 darken midtones; above 1.0 lighten them. Small changes (e.g., 0.90–1.10) are typical.

hint.title: White Point
hint.text: Levels highlight clamp (0–255). Lower values brighten highlights sooner; higher preserves more highlight detail. The default value is 255.

hint.title: Black Point
hint.text: Levels shadow clamp (0–255). Higher values deepen blacks sooner; lower preserves more shadow detail. The default value is 0.

hint.title: Per-Card Adjustment Layers
hint.text: Adds color and levels adjustments layers for each card, allowing you to easily fine-tune each card after generation within Photoshop. This option does not work with Batch PDF generation.

hint.title: Generate Card Back Page
hint.text: Creates a sheet designed for Card Backs. If this setting is selected then any Back Offset values will be used. This can also be important to use for layouts with odd symetry like the seven card layout so that it mittors the layout.

hint.title: Prompt for Each Card
hint.text: When enabled, you’ll be prompted to choose an image for every slot. When disabled, one selection can fill matching slots.

hint.title: Back Offset X (mm)
hint.text: Shifts the back sheet horizontally to align with your printed fronts. Positive shifts right; negative shifts left.

hint.title: Back Offset Y (mm)
hint.text: Shifts the back sheet vertically to align with your printed fronts. Positive shifts down; negative shifts up.

hint.title: Combine into Multi-page PDF
hint.text: Batch mode: combines generated sheets into a single multi-page batch PDF (fronts and, if used, backs).

hint.title: No Back Image
hint.text: Creates a Batch PDF with Card Fronts only. Skips selecting/placing a back image when preparing batches.

hint.title: Separate Back PDF
hint.text: Creates two seperate PDFs, one for the Front, and one for the Back.

hint.title: Show Notes on Sheet
hint.text: Add a small NOTE text layer with helpful info (e.g., batch/offset context) on the generated sheet. Some layouts do not have room for notes to appear, so you might want to turn this off on layouts with limited room at the bottom of the page.

hint.title: Note Text
hint.text: Optional free-form note to include on the sheet for labeling or reminders.

hint.title: Note Font Size
hint.text: Font size (pt) for the NOTE text. Decrease to help fit on the page.

hint.title: Photoshop Units and Rulers
hint.text: ProxySheet requires Rulers = Pixels and Type = Points. In Photoshop: Edit → Preferences → Units and Rulers (macOS: Photoshop → Settings → Units and Rulers). Set Rulers to Pixels and Type to Points.

hint.title: Make Photoshop the default app for .jsx (Windows)
hint.text: Right-click any .jsx → Open with → Choose another app → Adobe Photoshop → ✓ Always use this app → OK.

hint.title: Make Photoshop the default app for .jsx (macOS)
hint.text: Finder: select a .jsx → File → Get Info → Open with → Adobe Photoshop → Change All… → Continue.
